page.title: 05Fenland Farming-Kirton Area
page.content: Hundreds of years ago the land in this area was covered by water. Most of the farm land is only six feet above sea level. The land is well drained into dykes which take the water to the Wash. Farmers in this area grow a lot of sugar beet. Their other main crops are wheat, peas, potatoes, cauliflowers, cabbages, Brussel sprouts, onions and barley. Most jobs are done by machine but hoeing, cutting cauliflowers and picking daffodils are still done by hand. The number of farmworkers has slowly decreased in the last twenty years. Farmers now use big machines which save time and money. The fields are large because then the farmers are not always turning round in their big machines.
